frame.name: Key
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is for objects, physical or otherwise, which are used to grant access to some location or function.
<ex><fex name="Creator">Robert's</fex> <fex name="Type">master</fex> <t>keycard</t> <fex name="Function">opens any door in the building</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Robert's master <t>keycard</t> opens <fex name="Object">any door in the building</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Key
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the object that is designed to grant access to a location or function. This is the target LU, and this frame element is incorporated into each of this frame's LUs.</def-root>

FE.name: Function
FE.definition:
<def-root>The function that the <fen>Key</fen> grants access to.
<ex>Hand me the <t>key</t> <fex name="Function">that opens the garage</fex>.</ex>
<ex>This <t>password</t> <fex name="Function">allows access to the website</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition: <def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Key</fen> into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which an <fen>Key</fen> comes into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to an <fen>Key</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>An indication of the subtype of <fen>Key</fen>, often denoting the kind of device that the key operates on.
<ex>Is that a <fex name="Type">skeleton</fex> <t>key</t>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Key</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.</def-root>

FE.name: Location
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location that the <fen>Key</fen> grants access to.
<ex>These are the <t>keys</t> <fex name="Location">to the house</fex>.</ex>
<ex>I lost my <fex name="Location">office</fex> <t>keycard</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Object
FE.definition:
<def-root>The artifact that the key operates on.
<ex>My <fex name="Object">car</fex> <t>keys</t> are locked inside.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: key.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a metal object used for locking or unlocking barriers to physical locations, or for initiating functions of some device.

lexUnit.name: combination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A set of operations or sequence of symbols that can be input into a device to unlock a location or function.

lexUnit.name: password.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A sequence of characters that can be used to grant access to a physical or digital location.

lexUnit.name: passcard.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A physical card that allows access to a location or function.

lexUnit.name: keycard.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A physical card that allows access to a location or function; a passcard.
